html: Moab’s self-exaltation—like that of Greater Babylon—inevitably leads to humiliation in Jehovah’s Day of Judgment: “The haughty eyes of men shall be lowered and man’s pride abased; Jehovah alone shall be exalted in that day. Jehovah of Hosts has a day in store for all the proud and arrogant and for all who are exalted, that they may be brought low” (Isaiah 2:11-12). Rather than look down on the Moabites and glory at their fall, Jehovah’s people weep for them and deeply sorrow at their plight (vv 9, 11). They were a kindred people who lived alongside them, with whom Jehovah’s people interacted.
